In this PR, we add two results connecting accumulation points, discreteness, and nonatomic measures.

  • We show that a set with no accumulation points carries the discrete topology
  • Using this, we prove that any positive-measure, separable subset of a space with a nonatomic measure must contain an accumulation point
    This is my first PR, advice is welcome.

Hi @Theodore Meek. Thanks for this contribution! As expected from any first contribution in this area, you got afraid of filters and made everything complicated by applying every lemma you could find to escape filter world. Don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôll get to love filters. One possible first step is to understand why you can write

lemma discreteTopology_of_noAccPts {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {E : Set X}
    (h : ‚àÄ x ‚àà E, ¬¨ AccPt x (ùìü E)) : DiscreteTopology E := by
  simpa [discreteTopology_subtype_iff, AccPt] using h

Hi, thank you for your suggestion. I looked over it this morning, and it makes sense. I am only starting to appreciate the power of filters. I will do my best to not stray away from them in the future.
